description: A fridge for keeping food cool.  Provides some insulation from outside weather.
A disconnected freezer.  Can be plugged into a power source to start freezing food.
A disconnected electric convection-based oven, commonly used for heating and cooking food.
This device effectively sterilizes water, can be plugged into the wall and used.
A bulky upright arcade cabinet, brightly painted and slightly worn with age.  Ready to be plugged in and played.
A powerful drill mounted on a slide that lets it drop precisely down.  Useful in all kinds of projects from industrial fabrication to home woodworking.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off JET J-2500 Drill Press

description: A rotating sawblade set into a large flat table, for making straight measured cuts, a key tool in any carpenter's arsenal.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off Powermatic PM1000 Table Saw

description: A circular sawblade on an arm that can slide and rotate in several directions, this is a staple tool for nearly any carpentry.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off DEWALT 12-Inch Sliding Compound Miter Saw

description: A ribbonlike sawblade runs in a single direction in this tool, allowing precise cuts at almost any angle.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off JET JWBS-18-3 Woodworking Band Saw

description: This table has an inset router, a rotating motor with an exchangeable blade head for cutting specific profiles and grooves and stuff.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off Powermatic TS29 Shaper.  TODO: When support for multi-tile appliances is added, this can stretch two tiles

description: A hefty tool that will take in a board and cut it smooth and flat to a specific width, particularly great if working with raw lumber stock, but also good just for shaving wood down to size.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off JET JWP-15BHH Woodworking Planer

description: A table-shaped tool with a rotating blade that will cut down, smooth out, and square off a board to make it very smooth and nice indeed.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off Powermatic PJ-882 Jointer.  TODO: When support for multi-tile appliances is added, this can stretch two tiles

description: If you really want to squash something a lot, this would be exactly the right industrial tool for you.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off Daytona DSP20T Hydraulic Shop Press

description: This durable tank is topped with a motor that will cram as much air into the tank as possible.  Can be placed and plugged into a power source.
//: Based off Renegade Industrial 2.2HP 210LPM Air Compressor

description: This is an autoclave.  It's useful for sterilizing things like CBMs.  It requires a massive amount of power, so it will need to be plugged into a power grid.
A power cord, like you've seen many times before: it's a short multi-stranded copper cord with power outlet at the end.
An electrical device containing an electric lamp that provides illumination once plugged into a power outlet.
A large and heavy light designed to illuminate wide areas once plugged into a power outlet.
Electric wires used to run power through walls.

A universal recharging station integrated into a steel storage compartment.  When set up as an appliance and turned on, it will steadily charge all rechargeable batteries (battery cells, lead-acid batteries, etc) placed directly within its storage space.

A small device for recharging batteries integrated into a small wooden storage compartment.  When set up as an appliance and turned on, it will slowly charge all rechargeable batteries (battery cells, lead-acid batteries, etc) placed directly within its storage space.

A really heavy brick of metal housing an ASRG, formerly used by NASA and repurposed by the military.  Will provide about 130w, basically forever as far as you're concerned.  Should be safe due to the large amount of shielding.  Although these were designed for spacecraft, the sheer amount of armor plating and lead means it is much more massive, so you probably shouldn't try to power a vehicle with it.
//: I don't know how much these were worth pre-Cataclysm but the pu-238 alone is worth about 5-6 million and hundreds of millions were spent on research.  After the apocalypse these should basically be valuable beyond compare though.
